intro: Polycarpon bivonae var. herniarioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid and semi-arid regions. Its small, white flowers appear in spring, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain a single seed. The species is noted for its hirsute (hairy) foliage and is often confused with other similar species in the genus Polycarpon.
